description._content: Catalog #: 15_001729 Title: Piaggio-Pegna P.c.7 ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: No, this isn't an airplane being salvaged. It is the Piaggio-Pegna P.c.7, an ahead of its time hybrid. The plane would taxi utilizing a conventional boat type propeller below the waterline. As the plane approached takeoff speed, the nose would have been elevated by two main and one tail hydroplanes. The engine's power would then be shifted through clutches from the boat propeller in back to the aircraft propeller in front. An interesting design that just never made it to operational status. The press of the time nicknamed it ""The Flying Submarine"". Album Name: La Coppa Schneider 1982 Collection: Charles M. Daniels Collection Photo Page #: 55 Tags: Piaggio-Pegna P.c.7 PUBLIC COMMONS.SOURCE INSTITUTION: San Diego Air and Space Museum Archive
